core.conversion

Class AbstractConversion<S,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.transformation.AbstractTransformation<S,T>
      • core.conversion.AbstractConversion<S,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - The type of the source element to convert.
    T - The type of the target element to obtain.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConversion<S,T>, ITransformation<S,T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AssociationToRContextConversion, BooleanAttributeToFAttributeConversion, ClassToFContextConversion

    public abstract class AbstractConversion<S,T>
extends AbstractTransformation<S,T>
implements IConversion<S,T>
    an AbstractConversion abstract class that is used to factor the common interface and state of all concrete atomic metamodeling conversion classes.

    It must be specialized by all concrete metamodeling conversion classes.
    Author:
    Bachar Rima
    See Also:
    AbstractTransformation, IConversion

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class core.transformation.AbstractTransformation

        source, target

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractConversion()
      Creates an empty conversion
      AbstractConversion(S source)
      Creates an conversion from a source element and applies the conversion afterwards to directly get the target.
